intro: Tamijia, commonly known as the African violet, is a popular ornamental plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its foliage is thick and velvety, often with a waxy texture, and it is well-suited for indoor cultivation. Tamijia is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care and humidity conditions.
